古記録: (こきろく) - ancient document written without a particular addressee (e.g. a diary)
古訳: (こやく) - pre-Kumarajiva Chinese translation (i.e. before the 5th century)
古註: (こちゅう) - commentaries of the ancients
古語: (こご) - obsolete word; old proverb; ancient (Japanese) language
古豪: (こごう) - veteran; old-timer; man of experience
古跡: (こせき) - historic spot; historic remains; ruins
古道: (ふるみち) - old road/ancient road; (こどう only) ancient methods/ancient moral teachings/the way of learning
古道具: (こどうぐ) - old furniture; curios; secondhand goods
古酒: (ふるざけ) - well-cured sake; last year's sake; old sake
古里: (ふるさと) - home town/birthplace/native place/one's old home; (ふるさと only)  ruins/historic remains
古金: (ふるがね) - scrap iron; scrap metal
古鉄: (ふるてつ) - scrap iron; scrap metal
古顔: (ふるがお) - familiar face; old timer
古風土記: (こふどき) - (as opposed to those compiled later) ancient fudoki compiled by imperial order in 713 CE
古馬: (こば) - horses 4 or more years old (usu. in racing)
句: (ku) - phrase , section (ou seja, de texto), sentence, passage, paragraph; phrase; verse (of 5 or 7 mora in Japanese poetry; of 4, 5, or 7 characters in Chinese poetry); haiku, first 17 morae of a renga, etc.
句を作る: (くをつくる) - to compose a haiku poem
句を切る: (くをきる) - to punctuate a sentence
句切る: (くぎる) - (esp. 区切る) to demarcate/to delimit/to divide (an area)/to mark off/to cut off; (esp. 句切る) to punctuate/to put an end to (e.g. a sentence)/to insert pauses or breaks (e.g. when reading aloud)
句形: (くけい) - poetry form (esp. haiku); grammatical structure in kanbun
句心: (くごころ) - poetic instinct; taste for haiku
句構造文法: (くこうぞうぶんぽう) - phrase structure grammar; PSG
句構造規則: (くこうぞうきそく) - phrase structure rule
句法: (くほう) - conventions to be followed in composing Japanese poetry/phraseology/diction; rules of grammar and syntax when reading kanbun in Japanese
句読点: (くとうてん) - punctuation mark; punctuation marks
叩き: (タタキ) - (叩き, 敲き, タタキ only) mince (minced meat or fish); (叩き, 敲き only)  seared skipjack tuna; (叩き, 敲き only)  robbery/extortion; (usu. 三和土 ) hard-packed dirt (clay, gravel, etc.) floor/concrete floor; (叩き, タタキ only) whipping/lashing/bashing/beating/flaming
叩きあげる: (たたきあげる) - to work one's way up
叩きつける: (たたきつける) - to strike; to throw; to slap something onto
叩きなおす: (たたきなおす) - to beat into shape
叩きのめす: (たたきのめす) - to knock down; to beat up (till unable to stand)
叩き上げ: (たたきあげ) - working one's way up; self-made person/veteran
叩き上げる: (たたきあげる) - to work one's way up
叩き付ける: (たたきつける) - to strike; to throw; to slap something onto
叩き伏せる: (たたきふせる) - to knock down; to utterly defeat
叩き会う: (たたきあう) - to strike (each other)/to come to blows/to fight (each other); to speak (to each other)
叩き出す: (たたきだす) - to begin to strike; to kick out/to forcefully expel/to fire (someone); to hammer (pattern, etc.) into metal
叩き切る: (たたききる) - to mangle; to hack down; to chop down
叩き割る: (たたきわる) - to smash; to break into pieces
叩き台: (たたきだい) - chopping block; springboard for discussion/draft proposal/tentative plan
叩き合う: (たたきあう) - to strike (each other)/to come to blows/to fight (each other); to speak (to each other)
叩き壊す: (たたきこわす) - to tear down; to shatter
叩き売り: (たたきうり) - sacrifice sale; bargain sale; discount sale
叩き殺す: (たたきころす) - to beat to death
叩き消す: (たたきけす) - to beat out (a fire)
叩き潰す: (たたきつぶす) - to smash up; to defeat crushingly
叩き牛蒡: (たたきごぼう) - burdock root seasoned with sesame
叩き直す: (たたきなおす) - to beat into shape
叩き箸: (たたきばし) - ringing one's chopsticks against a dish (in order to request seconds, etc.) (a breach of etiquette)
叩き落とす: (たたきおとす) - to knock down; to knock off
叩き起こす: (たたきおこす) - to wake up; to rouse out of bed
叩き起す: (たたきおこす) - to wake up; to rouse out of bed
叩き込む: (たたきこむ) - to drive into; to throw into; to hit into
叩く: (はたく) - to strike/to clap/to knock/to dust/to beat; (たたく only) to play drums; (たたく only) to abuse/to flame (e.g. on the Internet)/to insult; (はたく only) to use up money; (たたく only)  to call/to invoke (e.g. a function)
叩けよ然らば開かれん: (たたけよさらばひらかれん) - Knock, and it shall be opened unto you
叩頭: (こうとう) - kowtow (bow made from a kneeling position wherein the forehead touches the ground)
叩頭虫: (コメツキムシ) - click beetle; skipjack (beetle of family Elateridae)
